metadata.synopsis: Jaheira's Topical Greetings. TGs are custom greetings in which companions respond to an event that has just occurred. In some cases, the topic is warrants some brief discussion before looping back to our regular topics.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to Jaheira after triggering any of the topical greeting conditions.

50.speaker: Jaheira
50.text: Shadowheart's choices are her own, but I bear no small blame. Viconia should have been rooted from the city years ago. First the Absolute - then, a reckoning.
50.context: NodeContext: Resigned pity and regret - feels partly responsible for what befell SH, but won't excuse her for the evil she's done. First we kill the Absolute, THEN we deal with it

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Careful what you wish for, Jaheira. I have some form in humbling ladies of your vintage.
110.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is now in control of the Shar cult. Responding to a threat from veiled threat from Jaheira.

293.speaker: Shadowheart
293.text: Careful what you wish for, Jaheira. I have some form in humbling ladies of your vintage.
293.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is now in control of the Shar cult. Responding to a threat from veiled threat from Jaheira.

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: Karlach deserves a better end than twisting herself into flayer-form. But then, she deserves a long life, too.
4.context: NodeContext: Grim, does not like Karlach's decision to sacrifice herself and become a mind flayer - but knows it's our only option

49.speaker: Jaheira
49.text: It is for her to make the choice, not I.

14.speaker: Jaheira
14.text: The Orphic Hammer. I will admit, I did not expect it to be an actual hammer.
14.context: NodeContext: We've gained the hammer, which is the key to our plan to save the world. SHe's mildly surprised that this mystical artefact is so literal.

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.text: Let us find Aylin and extend Lorroakan's invitation? It has been too long since I have seen a wizard cry.
17.context: NodeContext: Saluting player Wyll's new title with wry amusement, not mocking

21.speaker: Jaheira
21.text: The Grand Duke to be. I'd follow you into battle, Wyll - but politics? I think I am perhaps too faint of heart.
21.context: NodeContext: Saluting player Wyll's new title with wry amusement, not mocking

22.speaker: Jaheira
22.text: Play whatever part you must to get us closer to Orin's stone. It is not for me to question.
22.context: NodeContext: Hushed anger and warning - we're in the Murder Tribunal, pretending to be cold-hearted murderers to infiltrate the cult of Bhaal. She'd rather kill them all but is grudgingly playing along.

118.speaker: Jaheira
118.text: Only to remind you that it is a part.
118.context: NodeContext: Hushed anger and warning - we're in the Murder Tribunal, pretending to be cold-hearted murderers to infiltrate the cult of Bhaal. She'd rather kill them all but is grudgingly playing along.

23.speaker: Jaheira
23.text: We do not know this Prince of the Comet - a thin thread on which to hang all of our hopes.
23.context: NodeContext: Frustrated shrug - we've decided to trust Orpheus at the eleventh hour

263.speaker: Jaheira
263.text: Make your choice. Wherever it leads, we will follow.
263.context: NodeContext: Resignation - but she's trusted us this far, so she'll trust us a little longer

25.speaker: Jaheira
25.text: Come! We'll never bring the Brain low, trapped down here like fledgling chicks.
25.context: NodeContext: Brief pause in battle, urging us to get higher so we can attack the Brain that hovers above the city

30.speaker: Jaheira
30.text: I had no wish to lose Wyll, but - my, it would have been nice to flush her into the colony's flesh-pit.
30.context: NodeContext: Gritting her teeth after another encounter with a very haughty Mizora. Referencing the fact that we saved Mizora in the colony in order to save Wyll, but relishing the thought of having left her there.

34.speaker: Jaheira
34.text: You know, this might be the easy part. No planning. No doubt. Just the impossible task ahead - so try to have a little fun, yes?
34.context: NodeContext: Gallows cheer - the odds are against us, but all we can do is fight now

41.speaker: Jaheira
41.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers'. May the tortured rhymes recounting your deeds continue.
41.context: NodeContext: Wry amusement, saluting Wyll's choice to keep his title

42.speaker: Jaheira
42.text: To slay a devil in his domain is to end him entire. Or - it should be.
42.context: NodeContext: Not convinced Raphael is actually dead

310.speaker: Jaheira
310.text: I am still primed to hear some slimy final rhyme from beyond the grave.
310.context: NodeContext: Not convinced Raphael is actually dead

47.speaker: Jaheira
47.text: I was ready to advise you to make common cause with Viconia, if it would have served the city.
47.context: NodeContext: Quiet anger - she was willing to compromise in order to secure Viconia's help in the final battle, but the player went too far and surrendered Shadowheart to her

209.speaker: Jaheira
209.text: But to trade an ally like chattel - you and the Mother Superior make fine bedfellows already.

54.speaker: Jaheira
54.text: Ever will Shar try to twist bonds of love into chains of service. Shadowheart did not let her.
54.context: NodeContext: Pride in Shadowheart for not letting Shar manipulate her

69.speaker: Jaheira
69.text: I cannot presume to know her parents, or what they suffered - but I know that they were proud, in the end.
69.context: NodeContext: SH's parents just died at her hand in a mercy-killing

60.speaker: Jaheira
60.text: This ritual Astarion's spawn-kin spoke of - it seems his master has prepared a homecoming.
60.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic, note of foreboding - we've just heard of the Black Mass,  a ritual for which Cazador requires Astarion as a sacrifice

65.speaker: Jaheira
65.text: I'll not trust a word that slithers out of Gortash's mouth. I need to hear it from you.
65.context: NodeContext: Tense, not wanting to believe what she just heard from Gortash - that player is Bhaalspawn / started the Absolute plot. Deep breath, bracing - needs to hear it from us.

179.speaker: Jaheira
179.text: He knows that you are a Bhaalspawn, but he named you more than that. Bhaal's Chosen: one of the very people behind this plot. Is it true?
179.context: NodeContext: Tense, not wanting to believe what she just heard from Gortash - that player is Bhaalspawn / started the Absolute plot. Deep breath, bracing - needs to hear it from us.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: It's possible. You know I don't remember much.
64.context: NodeContext: Denial, doesn't want to hear us embracing our bloodline

294.speaker: Player
294.text: It doesn't matter. I am who I am - now.
294.context: NodeContext: Denial, doesn't want to hear us embracing our bloodline

315.speaker: Player
315.context: NodeContext: Denial, doesn't want to hear us embracing our bloodline

89.speaker: Jaheira
89.text: Choose your words carefully. There is a difference between what is true, and what is right.
89.context: NodeContext: Denial, doesn't want to hear us embracing our bloodline

46.speaker: Jaheira
46.text: I will not lie, and tell you that this does not cause me to doubt. But... it doesn't change anything.
46.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

295.speaker: Jaheira
295.text: What you were, the things you must have done... you cannot set it all to rights. But if you are still willing to try, then I am still with you.
295.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

59.speaker: Jaheira
59.text: Denying Gortash was the easy part. Come - it is your father we must face, in the end.

40.speaker: Jaheira
40.text: So ally yourself with Gortash if you see some benefit in it, and we'll reckon with him when we must. It is your Orin you must face, in the end - and your father.

233.speaker: Jaheira
233.text: He named you as Bhaal's Chosen. A Bhaalspawn. Is it true?
233.context: NodeContext: Tense, not wanting to believe what she just heard from Gortash - that player is Bhaalspawn / started the Absolute plot. Deep breath, bracing - needs to hear it from us.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I don't know, Jaheira. This is all new to me.
7.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I think Gortash is telling the truth. I've had... dreams.
109.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: And if I am? What does it mean?
57.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

191.speaker: Jaheira
191.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

84.speaker: Jaheira
84.text: The last time Bhaalspawn walked the world, it was only to serve their father's design. We got lucky in averting it once.
84.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

154.speaker: Jaheira
154.text: If your kind walk the world again... no. No. Doubt between us only serves Gortash - only serves the Absolute.
154.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself - this is all grim, but it doesn't change anything really so long as we are still going to do the right thing.

180.speaker: Jaheira
180.text: Give me some time. I... need to think.
180.context: NodeContext: Quiet - this is queueing up the confrontation she has with us at camp.

68.speaker: Jaheira
68.context: NodeContext: Grim. Karlach has just had her revenge on Gortash, who's responsible for the fact that she's going to die soon. Karlach flew into a helpless rage afterwards, realising she can't be cured. She then left for camp to be alone. Jaheira is not pretending to have any answers here - it's stupid and unfair, we can't do anything to stop it, but we should at least do whatever we can.

153.speaker: Jaheira
153.text: But more than this, I think. She needs to know she is not alone.
153.context: NodeContext: Listing all of the many things Karlach deserves but won't get. Not lecturing or bitter. Just knows all our good intentions won't help Karlach, and lying to ourselves about it won't either.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: What Karlach needs is for her friends to help her find a cure.
81.context: NodeContext: Listing all of the many things Karlach deserves but won't get. Not lecturing or bitter. Just knows all our good intentions won't help Karlach, and lying to ourselves about it won't either.

271.speaker: Jaheira
271.text: And answers. Justice. Ten years of her life back. All manner of things we cannot give her.
271.context: NodeContext: Listing all of the many things Karlach deserves but won't get. Not lecturing or bitter. Just knows all our good intentions won't help Karlach, and lying to ourselves about it won't either.

205.speaker: Jaheira
205.text: She's already lost her heart. She deserves better than to have her friends heap happy lies upon her.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'm not ready to give up on her just yet.

38.speaker: Jaheira
38.text: Good. Perhaps she needs that, too.

306.speaker: Player
306.text: That's easy for you to say. You've had the chance to live a full life.
306.context: NodeContext: Stop looking for a point in this, because there isn't one - it's just shit and unfair

255.speaker: Jaheira
255.text: Trust me. With the grand wisdom of centuries, I can make no more sense of this than you.
255.context: NodeContext: Stop looking for a point in this, because there isn't one - it's just shit and unfair

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I don't know what else to do, Jaheira.
26.context: NodeContext: Stop looking for a point in this, because there isn't one - it's just shit and unfair

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.context: NodeContext: Stop looking for a point in this, because there isn't one - it's just shit and unfair

152.speaker: Player
152.text: But she is alone. She's going to die.
152.context: NodeContext: Not diminishing Karlach's terminal illness, nor giving in to hopelessness - just stating a fact

148.speaker: Jaheira
148.text: That's a fate we'll all share, sooner or later. But speaking as one who has managed to put it off for so long...
148.context: NodeContext: Not diminishing Karlach's terminal illness, nor giving in to hopelessness - just stating a fact

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Help me convince her to return to Avernus.
211.context: NodeContext: Firm. Returning to Avernus will save Karlach, but would also return her to slavery. She respects what Karlach wants

86.speaker: Jaheira
86.text: I wish I could. But she alone knows what awaits her in Avernus, and she has made her choice.
86.context: NodeContext: Firm. Returning to Avernus will save Karlach, but would also return her to slavery. She respects what Karlach wants

298.speaker: Jaheira
298.text: If she cannot have the life she wants, she will at least die as she chooses.
298.context: NodeContext: Firm. Returning to Avernus will save Karlach, but would also return her to slavery. She respects what Karlach wants

273.speaker: Player
273.text: I just wish she'd stop sulking.
273.context: NodeContext: Slow, quiet contempt for our lack of pity for Karlach.

238.speaker: Jaheira
238.text: Why spare her feelings, then? Go to her. Tell her.
238.context: NodeContext: Slow, quiet contempt for our lack of pity for Karlach.

248.speaker: Jaheira
248.text: Whatever time remains to her is precious. She deserves to know just who she is wasting it on.
248.context: NodeContext: Slow, quiet contempt for our lack of pity for Karlach.

72.speaker: Jaheira
72.text: So your mysterious artefact, tamer of parasites - is only another parasite itself.
72.context: NodeContext: Sighing, talking herself around. It's not a good thing that we're working with an illithid, but we have no choice - and in the end, it's just another animal.

222.speaker: Jaheira
222.text: How do you feel, knowing the cost of keeping your transformation at bay?
222.context: NodeContext: Sighing, talking herself around. It's not a good thing that we're working with an illithid, but we have no choice - and in the end, it's just another animal.

288.speaker: Player
288.text: Better, actually. I know the artefact's true nature, now.
288.context: NodeContext: Sighing, talking herself around. It's not a good thing that we're working with an illithid, but we have no choice - and in the end, it's just another animal.

29.speaker: Jaheira
29.text: I suppose there is something to that.
29.context: NodeContext: Sighing, talking herself around. It's not a good thing that we're working with an illithid, but we have no choice - and in the end, it's just another animal.

128.speaker: Jaheira
128.text: Illithids are monstrous creatures. But... in the end, they are only that. Creatures.
128.context: NodeContext: Sighing, talking herself around. It's not a good thing that we're working with an illithid, but we have no choice - and in the end, it's just another animal.

214.speaker: Jaheira
214.text: And if it can, a parasite will keep its host fat, happy, and safe. Until it is finished feeding, at least. Am I comforting you? I am not comforting myself.
214.context: NodeContext: Sigh, shrugging - it's a shit situation, but up to us really.

160.speaker: Jaheira
160.text: Use the Emperor, as it would use you. Or discard it. My days of doubting you are done.
160.context: NodeContext: Sigh, shrugging - it's a shit situation, but up to us really.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Unclean. That thing was in my head.

138.speaker: Jaheira
138.text: Still is, probably. Along with a tadpole that, lest we forget, is just waiting for a chance to split your skull.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: We still need the illithid. Is that going to be a problem for you?

251.speaker: Jaheira
251.text: I want to say yes. But then, I was happy to work with a tainted True Soul when it suited my ends.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: The Emperor was an adventurer like us - a protector of the city. That has to count for something... ?

199.speaker: Jaheira
199.text: No notions of heroism put you above human failings. I should know - I've had my share of songs written about me.

73.speaker: Jaheira
73.text: How convenient - that the key to our salvation is the very corruption your illithid friend has been asking you to embrace all along.
73.context: NodeContext: Grim, dry, not believing a bit of it

76.speaker: Jaheira
76.text: Far from me to judge you for playing coy with Mystra. But I will not be cleaning up whatever mess she makes of you for it.
76.context: NodeContext: Note of disgust - glad to be out of the submersible and out of the harbour water

78.speaker: Jaheira
78.text: If I thought the city had despoiled the nature above - that harbour water was far from a sparkling blue.
78.context: NodeContext: Note of disgust - glad to be out of the submersible and out of the harbour water

80.speaker: Jaheira
80.text: I've spent over a century in this city, and still I cannot be sure there isn't more below the streets than above them.
80.context: NodeContext: Mute surprise - we've just found a patch of ruined city beneath the city itself

224.speaker: Player
224.text: You can't kill her, Jaheira - she'll escape to Avernus sooner than you could snatch a blade.

105.speaker: Wyll
105.text: You can't kill her, Jaheira - she'll escape to Avernus sooner than you could snatch a blade.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Wyll is a good man, and that is exactly what his devil will use to bind him, in as many ways she knows how.

36.speaker: Jaheira
36.text: Wyll is a good man, and that is exactly what his devil will use to bind him, in as many ways she knows how.

88.speaker: Jaheira
88.text: Leave Aylin to her sorrow. Likely the wizard only reminds of her of all the other fools, past and present, who have sought to use her.
88.context: NodeContext: Referring to Mizora lingering at camp. She's just bound Wyll in another pact, using the safe return of his father as leverage.

91.speaker: Jaheira
91.text: That preening vulture seems intent on haunting our camp. I suppose we shall find out if her kind sleep - and how heavily.
91.context: NodeContext: Referring to Mizora lingering at camp. She's just bound Wyll in another pact, using the safe return of his father as leverage.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: You think I was wrong to accept her terms?
102.context: NodeContext: Not judging Wyll for taking the pact - remembering those she lost, and what she would do in his place

268.speaker: Jaheira
268.text: I think that if I had the chance to snatch someone I loved from the jaws of death, I would not be asking for anyone else's opinion.
268.context: NodeContext: Not judging Wyll for taking the pact - remembering those she lost, and what she would do in his place

313.speaker: Jaheira
313.text: You are a good man, Wyll - and that is what your devil will use to bind you, in as many ways as she knows how.
313.context: NodeContext: Praise, but also hint of warning that Wyll is being manipulated

204.speaker: Jaheira
204.text: A man might twist himself into something else, just to escape that collar - but I have no such fears for the Blade.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: No harm can come to Mizora, Jaheira. I need her.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: I'd rather you focus on our other visitor. You must have met my father before?

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: Yes. As an ally - or occasional opponent - I know him to be an honourable man. He raised you well.

92.speaker: Jaheira
92.text: You deserve a better end than shredding your soul for our sake. But then, this is not a matter of what is deserved.
92.context: NodeContext: Grim, does not like our decision to sacrifice ourselves and become a mind flayer - but knows it's our only option

188.speaker: Jaheira
188.text: I will admit a petty sort of pleasure in your making the goddess look a lackwit, cleric.

231.speaker: Jaheira
231.text: I will admit a petty sort of pleasure in watching Shadowheart make the goddess look a lackwit.

98.speaker: Jaheira
98.text: 'The Blade of Avernus'. I suppose hell is just another frontier.
98.context: NodeContext: Wry amusement, saluting Wyll's choice to go from 'Blade of Frontiers' to 'Blade of Avernus'

103.speaker: Jaheira
103.text: You've found a little bit of yourself again. Do not let Selûne take all of the credit - she may have lit the way, but it is you who took the step.
103.context: NodeContext: Reflective - note of compassion. She just witnessed Astarion finally get revenge by killing Cazador, and still spare the other vampire spawn rather than sacrificing them to seize Cazador's power for himself. Knows he won't accept a direct compliment, so stating it to the air instead.

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: You've found a little bit of yourself again. Do not let Selûne take all of the credit - she may have lit the way, but it is you who took the step.

67.speaker: Jaheira
67.text: Shadowheart has found a little bit of herself again. Selûne cannot take all of the credit - she may have lit the way, but it is the cleric who took the step.

112.speaker: Jaheira
112.text: They say that the only thing a vampire can feel is hunger. Nothing else touches them - not grief, or mercy. Or any sense of what is just.
112.context: NodeContext: Reflective - note of compassion. She just witnessed Astarion finally get revenge by killing Cazador, and still spare the other vampire spawn rather than sacrificing them to seize Cazador's power for himself. Knows he won't accept a direct compliment, so stating it to the air instead.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Do they? Well, there must be something to it, then.
93.context: NodeContext: Rounding off her praise of Astarion as if it was just an idle thought

159.speaker: Astarion
159.text: Do they? Well, there must be something to it, then.
159.context: NodeContext: Rounding off her praise of Astarion as if it was just an idle thought

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Who knows. There is often more ignorance than insight in what 'they' say.
163.context: NodeContext: Rounding off her praise of Astarion as if it was just an idle thought

156.speaker: Jaheira
156.text: Who knows. There is often more ignorance than insight in what 'they' say.
156.context: NodeContext: Rounding off her praise of Astarion as if it was just an idle thought

75.speaker: Jaheira
75.text: Seven thousand souls. Astarion inherits his master's debts as well as his very fine palace. And when all of this is done, I plan on being a very nosey neighbour.
75.context: NodeContext: Quiet, reflective - just watched Astarion sacrifice thousands of vampire spawn, who died screaming.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Please do - I would love to have you for supper.

218.speaker: Astarion
218.text: Please do - I would love to have you for supper.

116.speaker: Jaheira
116.text: The wizard is a twit, but he is not a fool. Our ruse will buy only a short reprieve - we ought to tell Dame Aylin.
116.context: NodeContext: Distaste, but also pity - player-Shadowheart has just been manipulated into sacrificing her parents to Shar, and then had the memory erased

158.speaker: Jaheira
158.text: This will not end until she ends it.

120.speaker: Jaheira
120.text: Do not trust a word that slithers out of Lord Liar's mouth. It suits the cult to have us divided - doubting one another.
120.context: NodeContext: Distaste, but also pity - player-Shadowheart has just been manipulated into sacrificing her parents to Shar, and then had the memory erased

198.speaker: Jaheira
198.text: None of us know every detail of one another's past. But we know who we are now - together.

121.speaker: Jaheira
121.text: All hail the mighty Sharran. A-glow with some victory she cannot even recall.
121.context: NodeContext: Distaste, but also pity - player-Shadowheart has just been manipulated into sacrificing her parents to Shar, and then had the memory erased

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I'm more than a simple Sharran now. You may call me Mother Superior.
119.context: NodeContext: Not buying into our bullshit at all

282.speaker: Jaheira
282.context: NodeContext: Not buying into our bullshit at all

139.speaker: Player
139.text: It's Shar's victory over the Absolute I think of. Whatever the cost, it was worth it.
139.context: NodeContext: Not convinced by our efforts to justify sacrificing SH's parents

45.speaker: Jaheira
45.text: Repeat that mantra. Make of it a prayer, and see if it will save you.
45.context: NodeContext: Not convinced by our efforts to justify sacrificing SH's parents

66.speaker: Jaheira
66.text: You've made your choices. Whatever they have made of you, this city is still your home.
66.context: NodeContext: Distaste - we're allies for the fight ahead so she has to be pragmatic. But this isn't acceptance- only a temporary truce

106.speaker: Jaheira
106.text: We can have our reckoning over the rubble afterwards.
106.context: NodeContext: Distaste - we're allies for the fight ahead so she has to be pragmatic. But this isn't acceptance- only a temporary truce

264.speaker: Player
264.text: I don't remember what happened, Jaheira. Why don't you tell me?

178.speaker: Jaheira
178.text: For whose benefit? It is your Lady who draws power from your pain, not I.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Let's go. We have a city to save.
1.context: NodeContext: Quiet promise of future conflict

258.speaker: Jaheira
258.context: NodeContext: Quiet promise of future conflict

123.speaker: Jaheira
123.text: I thought the Harpers knew every hidey-hole and rat-run in the city. This place housed something slightly larger than a rat, I think.
123.context: NodeContext: Looking around a massive chamber beneath Wyrm's Crossing

124.speaker: Jaheira
124.text: Shadowheart walks a little freer of the shadows. She could shave her skull and paint it purple - it would still suit her.
124.context: NodeContext: Slight reproach, but moving past it.

130.speaker: Jaheira
130.text: You might have mentioned you had githyanki gish roiling around in your pocket.
130.context: NodeContext: Slight reproach, but moving past it.

208.speaker: Jaheira
208.text: Come - they've disturbed my first peaceful sleep in a lifetime. Reason enough to be rid of them.
208.context: NodeContext: Slight reproach, but moving past it. More important things to deal with - the 'they' here being githyanki monks who attacked our camp in the night

131.speaker: Jaheira
131.text: We'd be fools to retaliate against Cazador by night. But we shouldn't wait long past morning - I doubt the homecoming he plans for Astarion is a happy one.
131.context: NodeContext: Surveying aftermath of a battle with vampire spawn in which Astarion was kidnapped

140.speaker: Jaheira
140.text: Welcome back to the world, Karlach. Try not to break it, yes?
140.context: NodeContext: Fond smile - Karlach just got a treatment that means she can touch thing again

196.speaker: Jaheira
196.text: Welcome back to the world, Karlach. Try not to break it, yes?
196.context: NodeContext: Fond smile - Karlach just got a treatment that means she can touch thing again

194.speaker: Jaheira
194.text: Handle the berserker's heart with care, yes? Just because it is made of metal does not mean it cannot be broken.
194.context: NodeContext: Gentle warning to be nice to Karlach if we're her partner. She's tough, but needs care too

44.speaker: Jaheira
44.text: We can speak to Karlach of Avernus later. Let her live in this world a little, while she is able.
44.context: NodeContext: Sad about the fact that Karlach can only live if she returns to the hells, but not wanting to have that fight tonight, when she's still so happy.

141.speaker: Jaheira
141.text: All we achieved was sending the devil home - and damning Wyll along with her. It is a lesson worth learning, I think - that this company discards allies so easily.
141.context: NodeContext: Grim distaste - we just killed Mizora, which dragged our ally Wyll to the hells along with her.

144.speaker: Jaheira
144.text: Orin snatches a child to clamour for our attention. She has it.
144.context: NodeContext: Quiet, restrained anger - but hint of fury beneath. Orin has kidnapped and threatened a child to force us to come to her.

151.speaker: Jaheira
151.text: We just played host to an undying queen - and us without our fine silverware.
151.context: NodeContext: Dry - we just had a large and loud God-Queen imperiously appear in our camp as a hologram - Jaheira did not like her

74.speaker: Jaheira
74.text: You have courage, child of Gith. It is no small thing to turn your back on all the ideals of a lifetime.
74.context: NodeContext: Impressed with us - we pushed back on Vlaakith, to whom we had been dedicated

243.speaker: Player
243.text: Vlaakith will come for Prince Orpheus. Can he count on your support?
243.context: NodeContext: Cares nothing for githyanki politics, but will fight for us personally if she ahs to

227.speaker: Jaheira
227.text: I try not to play at politics, especially those of another plane. Your prince's battle is his own.
227.context: NodeContext: Cares nothing for githyanki politics, but will fight for us personally if she ahs to

317.speaker: Jaheira
317.text: But, should great Vlaakith come to settle a score with you - I suppose I could be convinced to kill her.
317.context: NodeContext: Cares nothing for githyanki politics, but will fight for us personally if she ahs to

270.speaker: Jaheira
270.text: Undying or not, she was very loud.

129.speaker: Player
129.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, hinting at some previous crises of faith she had herself. She is a Harper, but she doesn't fight for causes blindly

235.speaker: Jaheira
235.text: I was not always a Harper. I only returned to their fold once I knew it was my own cause I fought for - not whichever one they assigned to me.
235.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, hinting at some previous crises of faith she had herself. She is a Harper, but she doesn't fight for causes blindly

220.speaker: Jaheira
220.text: You've learned to choose your own course. Enjoy that dizzying sense of freedom - after comes twice the headaches.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: Spare me your wise counsel, greyling. I did not ask for it.

226.speaker: Jaheira
226.text: As I said - it is no small thing.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Vlaakith will not never stop hunting Prince Orpheus. Can he count on your support?

221.speaker: Lae'zel
221.text: Vlaakith will not never stop hunting Prince Orpheus. Can he count on your support?

100.speaker: Jaheira
100.text: Lae'zel has courage, turning her back on a lifetime's belief. As for us - best we stay out of interplanar politics, I think. Orpheus is on his own.

276.speaker: Jaheira
276.text: But - should great Vlaakith come to settle a score with Lae'zel, well. I might be convinced to kill her.

164.speaker: Jaheira
164.text: This ritual your spawn-kin spoke of - it seems your master has prepared a homecoming for you, Astarion.
164.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic, note of foreboding - we've just heard of the Black Mass,  a ritual for which Cazador requires Astarion as a sacrifice

166.speaker: Jaheira
166.text: You are a better man than most, to choose what is right even after what Mystra asked of you.
166.context: NodeContext: Quiet, warning us not to dally in Cazador's palace

167.speaker: Jaheira
167.text: Let's not linger long. I have no desire to avail ourselves of a vampire lord's hospitality.
167.context: NodeContext: Quiet, warning us not to dally in Cazador's palace

213.speaker: Jaheira
213.text: It is rare to meet so true a believer, child of Gith. Despite reason's every attempt to sway you, you stay your course.
213.context: NodeContext: Not fully mocking, but eyebrows raised at how staunchly we stick with Vlaakith, who is clearly an asshole

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Prince Orpheus will die. Don't make me take your life in the bargain.

79.speaker: Jaheira
79.text: But it is not just my life, or that of Orpheus - is it? Do you truly believe your queen will save you, when you are no longer of use to her?

182.speaker: Jaheira
182.text: For your sake, I hope you are right. But I fear you are not.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I will not be mocked, Harper.

94.speaker: Jaheira
94.text: I do not mock loyalty. Only mourn when it is given so freely to those so undeserving.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Do you expect me to explain myself to you?

192.speaker: Jaheira
192.text: No explanation required. The loyal soldier serves her queen, and receives rewards undying in return.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: And none believe quite so hard as those who have given themselves no other choice.

228.speaker: Jaheira
228.text: Be wary of Lae'zel. She chose loyalty, yes - but there are none so dangerous as those who only believe because they must.

175.speaker: Jaheira
175.text: Halsin long urged the Harpers not to abandon this land to the curse. I cannot blame him, for being unable to bear it a second time.
175.context: NodeContext: Quiet, restrained anger - but hint of fury beneath. Orin has kidnapped and threatened a companion to force us to come to her.

176.speaker: Jaheira
176.text: The great Orin the Red tugs your sleeve, sulking for attention. She might come to regret it yet.
176.context: NodeContext: Quiet, restrained anger - but hint of fury beneath. Orin has kidnapped and threatened a companion to force us to come to her.

61.speaker: Jaheira
61.text: Gale has lived under the threat of death for some time, but Orin will make him beg for it - if we give her the time.
61.context: NodeContext: note of foreboding - our companion might be strong, but Orin will break anyone

183.speaker: Jaheira
183.text: You plan to become a god now, do you? And all because your lover spurned you.
183.context: NodeContext: Distaste, looking around the repurposed headquarters of a faction she took down many years ago

184.speaker: Jaheira
184.text: The Iron Throne. Named for the sordid cabal of warmongers it was once headquarters to. No wonder Gortash feels at home.
184.context: NodeContext: Distaste, looking around the repurposed headquarters of a faction she took down many years ago

187.speaker: Jaheira
187.text: We've done what we came to do, and we are all of us sullied for it. Let us make it worth it.
187.context: NodeContext: Tight-lipped anger, and herself and us. We were masquerading as devotees of Bhaal to gain access to his temple - but we went to far and completed a sacrifice to do it. She'll salvage something from this, but only because not to waste it.

189.speaker: Jaheira
189.text: The Gur have been fighting evil longer than this city has stood. It was not for us to gainsay them.
189.context: NodeContext: Stifling her reservations. We just helped the Gur kill the vampire lord Astarion, having been swayed to believe that he'd gone too far. It doesn't sit well with her to betray an ally, but it's done.

62.speaker: Jaheira
62.text: I have no love for the drow, but she is one of us. We cannot leave her beneath Orin's knife.
62.context: NodeContext: note of foreboding - our companion might be strong, but Orin will break anyone

195.speaker: Jaheira
195.text: Gale plans to become a god now, does he? And all because his lover spurned him.
195.context: NodeContext: 'by the stars' is akin to 'by the gods'.

53.speaker: Jaheira
53.text: By the stars, it is probably not even the most foolish cause that has seen mortals rise to divinity.
53.context: NodeContext: 'by the stars' is akin to 'by the gods'.

200.speaker: Jaheira
200.text: Do not trust a word that slithers out of Lord Liar's mouth. It suits the cult to have us divided - doubting one another.
200.context: NodeContext: Pride in Shadowheart for not letting Shar manipulate her

107.speaker: Jaheira
107.text: The things our companion has done... they might never be set right. But so long as we are still willing to try, then I know I am in the right company.

201.speaker: Jaheira
201.text: Ever will Shar try to twist bonds of love into chains of service. You did not let her.
201.context: NodeContext: Pride in Shadowheart for not letting Shar manipulate her

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: I cannot presume to know your parents, or what they suffered - but I know that they were proud, in the end.
52.context: NodeContext: SH's parents just died at her hand in a mercy-killing

210.speaker: Jaheira
210.text: Harpers are supposed to be virtuous. But if I had my tormentor at my mercy, the means to punish him at hand...
210.context: NodeContext: Raised eyebrows, reflecting on Astarion choosing to kill Cazador and end the ritual rather than ascending in his place.

289.speaker: Jaheira
289.text: I am not sure I would have the grace to give him such a quick death.
289.context: NodeContext: Raised eyebrows, reflecting on Astarion choosing to kill Cazador and end the ritual rather than ascending in his place.

150.speaker: Player
150.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

265.speaker: Jaheira
265.text: True. But not half the horror he had earned.
265.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

230.speaker: Jaheira
230.text: Careful, Astarion. Despite your every effort to the contrary, I am in danger of thinking you might be a good man.
230.context: NodeContext: Wry, knows Astarion will deflect but acknowledging that he did a noble thing.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: I'll soon be skulking from the sun again - there's nothing terribly graceful about that.
217.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

135.speaker: Jaheira
135.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

70.speaker: Jaheira
70.text: Besides, take heart. Your tadpole may yet burst from your skull before it comes to that.
70.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic cheer, but actually trying to cheer Astarion up. He sacrificed his ability to walk in sunlight for the greater good.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I wanted to kill him, not become him.
161.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

133.speaker: Jaheira
133.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: I was actually planning to finish the ritual. My knife just slipped.
308.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

146.speaker: Jaheira
146.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be deflected - Astarion did a noble thing.

215.speaker: Jaheira
215.text: If you feel you are being watched, take comfort - that is only because you are.
215.context: NodeContext: Quiet - dry gallows humour. We're in a mind flayer colony, a deadly alien environment. She's been in one before

12.speaker: Jaheira
12.text: The colony knows we are here. Already I can hear the whispers.
12.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

99.speaker: Player
99.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

172.speaker: Jaheira
172.text: Just sweet nothings for now. It tests me - wants to know why I do not carry a tadpole, as you do.
172.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: What is this? Some Harperish sixth sense?
281.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

108.speaker: Jaheira
108.text: Hah, a sharper sense than that. That of painful experience.
108.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

279.speaker: Jaheira
279.text: A colony is a sentience, comprised of the collective. For anything outside of that collective - assimilation, or annihilation.
279.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

126.speaker: Jaheira
126.text: If it tries to dominate me, turn me against you... well. I have seen you fight. I'm sure you'll be fine.
126.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

262.speaker: Player
262.text: You speak as if this place is alive.
262.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

203.speaker: Jaheira
203.text: If you can call this living.
203.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

303.speaker: Player
303.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

272.speaker: Jaheira
272.context: NodeContext: Very slight hint of strain, but powering through with wry amusement. A mind flayer colony assaults the minds of any who are not part of the collective, trying to dominate them. But she's been through it before.

216.speaker: Jaheira
216.text: That pointy-hatted old fart talks too much. But he has also moved mountains, walked between planes, and dragged himself back from death a dozen times.
216.context: NodeContext: Wry fondness in 'pointy-hatted far' - she speaks of Elminster,one of the most powerful wizards alive, and an old ally from previous games.

219.speaker: Jaheira
219.text: That pointy-hatted old fart talks too much. But he has also moved mountains, walked between planes, and dragged himself back from death a dozen times.
219.context: NodeContext: Wry fondness in 'pointy-hatted far' - she speaks of Elminster,one of the most powerful wizards alive, and an old ally from previous games.

104.speaker: Jaheira
104.text: If he still believes in you, I would not be overly concerned what your lady love thinks - goddess, or no.
104.context: NodeContext: Comfort for Gale - Mystra has abandoned him, but Elminster has not. She makes it clear whose opinion she values more.

111.speaker: Jaheira
111.text: If he still believes in Gale, the boy should not be overly concerned what his lady love thinks - goddess, or no.
111.context: NodeContext: Comfort for Gale - Mystra has abandoned him, but Elminster has not. She makes it clear whose opinion she values more.

223.speaker: Jaheira
223.text: Pay me no mind. It is only... this place is familiar, somehow.
223.context: NodeContext: Shaking head, distracted - we're drawing near the Temple of Bhaal, where she and the party of previous games fought the final battle of BG1.

225.speaker: Jaheira
225.text: Cazador is keen to greet his wayward son once more - with open arms, or iron shackles.
225.context: NodeContext: Dry, understated - we've just been ambushed in the night by vampire spawn who tried to kidnap Astarion.

229.speaker: Jaheira
229.text: You've made your choice - and us with you, Silvanus spare us. The princeling will save his people - just not in the way he imagined.
229.context: NodeContext: Grim resolve - we've decided to sacrifice Orpheus, allowing the Emperor to consume his brain so that we might have the power to defeat the Brain

234.speaker: Jaheira
234.text: In another lifetime, I might have stood on the other side of that fight. We can call it a lesser evil, but it did not feel like one.
234.context: NodeContext: Regret at having been forced to kill the Gur, who wanted to kill Astarion

51.speaker: Jaheira
51.text: The Gur are wise, but they do not know you. They do not believe that you can rise above your hunger - for blood, or power. Please prove them wrong.
51.context: NodeContext: Urging player-Astarion to be worthy of the faith that's been placed in him

239.speaker: Jaheira
239.text: Far from me to judge Gale for playing coy with Mystra. But I will not be cleaning up whatever mess she makes of him for it.
239.context: NodeContext: Keen to be on with the hunt - we stand on top of Moonrise Tower, having just forced Ketheric to retreat down into the Colony.

240.speaker: Jaheira
240.text: Come. The great General flees us - but he left a trail to follow.
240.context: NodeContext: Keen to be on with the hunt - we stand on top of Moonrise Tower, having just forced Ketheric to retreat down into the Colony.

244.speaker: Jaheira
244.text: Breathe deep - that is the true scent of Baldur's Gate assaulting your nostrils.
244.context: NodeContext: Wry - we're wandering down in the sewers

319.speaker: Jaheira
319.text: Lae'zel will not break easily - but Orin will only enjoy her work the more for that, if we give her the time.
319.context: NodeContext: note of foreboding - our companion might be strong, but Orin will break anyone

247.speaker: Jaheira
247.text: Gale is a better man than most, to choose what is right even after what Mystra asked of him.
247.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

136.speaker: Jaheira
136.text: Me, I think I would have tugged the great goddess' hair a bit first.

249.speaker: Jaheira
249.text: Karlach. Recall that I am an old woman, and you cannot strike me for asking stupid questions.
249.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

58.speaker: Jaheira
58.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Not really in the mood for jokes, Jaheira. Sorry.
6.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Don't worry about me, ma'am. Still focused on the fight.
127.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

186.speaker: Player
186.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

309.speaker: Jaheira
309.text: On second thought, I think I would prefer it if you hit me.

0.speaker: Player
0.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

115.speaker: Jaheira
115.text: I wish I could make some sense of all this for you. I cannot. But I do know this.
115.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: I have fought hollow shells of men who clawed for more life as if it was their gods-given right. And not a one of them would've known what to do with it if they had succeeded.
16.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: This world is a better place with you in it, for as little or as long as it is lucky enough to have you. It is most certainly a better place without Enver Gortash. And, if I may borrow a phrase from you...
8.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

71.speaker: Jaheira
71.context: NodeContext: Leaning in quietly, as if trying out a phrase she knows she shouldn't.

97.speaker: Jaheira
97.text: All right, now. Watch your language.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Sorry, Jaheira. That just sounds wrong coming from you.

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: Agreed. I have been spending too much time with the wild and rebellious youth.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Does it matter? I'll be joining him soon enough.

241.speaker: Jaheira
241.text: It matters. If you cannot live as you wish, then you can at least die as you choose.

302.speaker: Jaheira
302.text: It makes me feel better, at least. If that makes me selfish, then I suppose I am selfish.

252.speaker: Jaheira
252.text: Shar believes us so fearful of pain that we would empty our lives of all other feeling just to escape it.
252.context: NodeContext: Shaking her head at how Shar underestimated Shadowheart

134.speaker: Jaheira
134.text: And still you signed his contract. Perhaps it was the wiser course, but I have trouble believing our problems can be solved so easily.
134.context: NodeContext: Not fully questioning our decision to trust Raphael - but coming close

257.speaker: Jaheira
257.text: The Harpers have known many defeats - but slinking from this land when the shadow-curse first fell was one of our most shameful.
257.context: NodeContext: Grim regret at her memory of leaving the shadowlands cursed

242.speaker: Jaheira
242.text: Thank you, for doing what we could not. You and Halsin both.
242.context: NodeContext: Quiet nod of respect - we didn't lift the curse for her, but she's grateful

261.speaker: Jaheira
261.text: I sometimes wondered if Viconia had returned to the Underdark. But instead she brought her sordid little patch of darkness to the city with her.
261.context: NodeContext: Reflective after seeing an old ally / enemy in the city. Distaste - Viconia continued on a dark path, and for that Jaheira has only contempt.

269.speaker: Jaheira
269.text: So Shar - and who knows what other gods - fight over the Prism like brats over boiled sweets. And it is the mortal realms that suffer.
269.context: NodeContext: Disgust at the pettiness of the gods that set this entire conflict in motion.

290.speaker: Jaheira
290.text: Would that there was a hand big enough to smack them all. Meaning no insult, Oakfather Silvanus.
290.context: NodeContext: Disgust at the pettiness of the gods that set this entire conflict in motion. Last line is a brief flick of the eyes upward, as if correcting herself - she doesn't mean HER god, of course

277.speaker: Jaheira
277.text: 'The Steel Foundry builds a brighter future for all'. Unless you happen to work here. Or live nearby. Or require clean air to breathe.
277.context: NodeContext: Quoting some pamphlet / posters about the Foundry, in contrast to the miserable place it actually is

286.speaker: Jaheira
286.text: The devil's den is every bit as gaudy as I would have imagined.
286.context: NodeContext: Distaste - unfazed that we're in the Hells, more focused on Raphael's tacky interior design

301.speaker: Jaheira
301.text: I have met few as strong as Halsin - but Orin will break him, if we give her the time to do it.
301.context: NodeContext: note of foreboding - our companion might be strong, but Orin will break anyone

291.speaker: Jaheira
291.text: It is said vampires only make a show of feeling - that their only true emotion is hunger. But those screams sounded real enough.
291.context: NodeContext: Quiet, reflective - just watched Astarion sacrifice thousands of vampire spawn, who died screaming.

157.speaker: Jaheira
157.text: Seven thousand souls, Astarion. That is all it cost to inherit your master's power. His position. His very fine palace.
157.context: NodeContext: Quiet, reflective - just watched Astarion sacrifice thousands of vampire spawn, who died screaming.

177.speaker: Jaheira
177.text: Know that when all of this is done, I plan on being a very nosey neighbour.
177.context: NodeContext: Hint of warning - Astarion has ascended as a vampire lord to better face the Absolute, but she'll be watching him.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: Oh, do. I would love to have you for supper.
259.context: NodeContext: Unmoved by Astarion's veiled threat to feed on her - she'll shelve it until after we kill the Absolute, but she plans on making sure he doesn't prey on the city

18.speaker: Jaheira
18.text: It is ill-mannered to bite off more than you can chew, my Lord.
18.context: NodeContext: Unmoved by Astarion's veiled threat to feed on her - she'll shelve it until after we kill the Absolute, but she plans on making sure he doesn't prey on the city

296.speaker: Player
296.text: Baldur's Gate will tremble before us.
296.context: NodeContext: Correcting Astarion - and clarifying that she'll only tolerate him in the city so long as he reins in his appetite

31.speaker: Jaheira
31.text: Its enemies, I trust you mean. And without your hunger, you have little need to feed on living creatures.
31.context: NodeContext: Correcting Astarion - and clarifying that she'll only tolerate him in the city so long as he reins in his appetite

283.speaker: Jaheira
283.text: Cazador would have used his power to prey on the city. If you say you will be its protector, instead - I plan to hold you to that standard.
283.context: NodeContext: Correcting Astarion - and clarifying that she'll only tolerate him in the city so long as he reins in his appetite

246.speaker: Player
246.text: Don't cry for vampire spawn. Through me, they might actually serve some good.
246.context: NodeContext: Correcting Astarion - and clarifying that she'll only tolerate him in the city so long as he reins in his appetite

212.speaker: Jaheira
212.text: It is for you to make sure that is so. And your debt will extend far beyond the end of the Absolute.
212.context: NodeContext: Correcting Astarion - and clarifying that she'll only tolerate him in the city so long as he reins in his appetite

125.speaker: Player
125.text: I don't plan on being another Cazador, Jaheira. You have nothing to fear.
125.context: NodeContext: Acknowleding that player-Astarion has good intentions for his power as a vampire lord - but warning that she will remain vigilant

193.speaker: Jaheira
193.text: I believe you. In this very moment, at least. But you might live long enough to forget your promises. The meaning of hunger, pain and fear.
193.context: NodeContext: Acknowleding that player-Astarion has good intentions for his power as a vampire lord - but warning that she will remain vigilant

206.speaker: Jaheira
206.text: Do not force the people of this city to remind you, as you reminded Cazador.
206.context: NodeContext: Acknowleding that player-Astarion has good intentions for his power as a vampire lord - but warning that she will remain vigilant

292.speaker: Jaheira
292.text: I did not know Duke Ravengard that well - but I'm sure he would not want his son to become slave to Zariel for his sake.
292.context: NodeContext: Trying to comfort Wyll on his father's death, which might have been avoided by Wyll pacting himself to an archdevil

236.speaker: Jaheira
236.text: But - still. I am sorry, Wyll. It is a hard thing to lose someone, and wonder if you might have saved them.
236.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, knows there is no real comfort and that Wyll will have moments of blaming himself regardless

253.speaker: Player
253.text: What would your children have done in my place?
253.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she broke down after losing her husband in previous games, over 100 years ago.

171.speaker: Jaheira
171.text: In truth - I do not know. I raised them to make their own choices, as your father did you.

165.speaker: Player
165.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she broke down after losing her husband in previous games, over 100 years ago.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Thank you, Jaheira. I appreciate it.
122.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she broke down after losing her husband in previous games, over 100 years ago.

90.speaker: Jaheira
90.text: No one truly understands the weight of loss until they've worn it a while. There is no shame in sharing the load, when you need to.
90.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she broke down after losing her husband in previous games, over 100 years ago.

267.speaker: Jaheira
267.text: And when all of this is over, I will hug my children so hard that Rion might kill me from sheer surprise.
267.context: NodeContext: Wry amusement, trying to take the edge off talk of grief

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Spare me your pity. I saved myself, and that's what matters.
83.context: NodeContext: We've pushed back on her commiserations for causing the death of our father - she's not buying it.

95.speaker: Jaheira
95.text: Such... certainty. I hope it sustains you in the days to come.
95.context: NodeContext: We've pushed back on her commiserations for causing the death of our father - she's not buying it.

197.speaker: Jaheira
197.text: I am sure Wyll knows that - but we would do well to remind him, when his days grow dark.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You sound like you speak from experience.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I hoped we'd find another way to free him from his pact.

299.speaker: Jaheira
299.text: Hope. The very hook from which these devils try to hang us. I have no answers - for you, or for Wyll.

170.speaker: Jaheira
170.text: But if Mizora means to linger with us, I mean to find out if devils do indeed sleep - and just how heavily.
170.context: NodeContext: Note of threat creeping in - shit-eating Mizora is the cause of all Wyll's grief

77.speaker: Player
77.text: He sacrificed his father. Do you really believe he deserves our comfort?
77.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she understands why we would be mad with Wyll, but that won't help him

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: I don't know. But if he comes asking for it, I hope you have more to offer him than your judgement alone.
63.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she understands why we would be mad with Wyll, but that won't help him

297.speaker: Jaheira
297.text: Let us leave this place. Your Prism - and its occupant - are safe-guarded for now.
297.context: NodeContext: Grim. She's just learned our protection from the Absolute stems from a mind flayer. Not pleased, but knows this is not the place or time.

312.speaker: Jaheira
312.text: The great devil grows sloppy. He makes his offer, but only after telling us where to find what we seek. The Orphic Hammer.
312.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with smarmy Raphael and his show of confidence

300.speaker: Jaheira
300.text: I suppose we will have to see if this House of Hope is open to visitors.

314.speaker: Jaheira
314.text: Grand Duke, is it? I'd follow Wyll into battle, sure enough - but politics? I think I am perhaps too faint of heart.
314.context: NodeContext: Saluting Wyll's new title with wry amusement, not mocking

316.speaker: Jaheira
316.text: I never met Zevlor, but the way his people spoke of him... hatred, but grief as well. For the man they thought he was.
316.context: NodeContext: Weary pity. The corpse of the tiefling's disgraced leader just turned up in our camp, a 'gift' from Orin. From a note she left we learn that Zevlor was fooled into joining the cult in the hope it would save his people.

275.speaker: Jaheira
275.text: He betrayed them, but only in the hopes of saving them. It will comfort the others little to know that.
275.context: NodeContext: Weary pity. The corpse of the tiefling's disgraced leader just turned up in our camp, a 'gift' from Orin. From a note she left we learn that Zevlor was fooled into joining the cult in the hope it would save his people.

318.speaker: Jaheira
318.text: We draw near to the beast's den - where it will be most desperate. I need no tadpole to feel that much.
318.context: NodeContext: Grim determination - we're getting close to the brain
